item.title: [Pi] Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:7, topic:524012”][quote author=bob2568 link=topic=642554.msg4327169#msg4327169 date=1373133779]
&king that was the yell command from deathlypvpz, it’s horrible.

@rip, how so ? What about my explanation is incorrect, equalsIgnoreCase would check for the exact chars I set,
[/quote]
Yell shouldn’t be using the equalsIgnoreCase method because although it’s not case sensitive, the command has to be exactly “yell”, not yell messageHere like you want it to be.[/quote]
if (cmd.toLowerCase().startsWith("yell "))

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Nice but it’s kinda messy. You could make a table of contents quite easily by using the [anchor] code.

Example:
[iurl=#example1]Click for example 1[/iurl]
[iurl=#example1]Click for example 1[/iurl]

[iurl=#example2]Click for example 2[/iurl]
[iurl=#example2]Click for example 2[/iurl]

[anchor=example1]I am example 1.
[anchor=example1]I am example 1.

[anchor=example2]I am example 2.
[anchor=example2]I am example 2.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:20, topic:524012”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=642554.msg4328547#msg4328547 date=1373334951]
An ‘easier’ fix for the command thing everyone it talking about:
change this:

String playerCommand = c.getInStream().readString();

to this:

String playerCommand = c.getInStream().readString().toLowerCase();

I believe I made a post in snippets about this.
What it does is it takes the string playerCommand, and reads it then makes it all lowercase, thus removing the need to do this:

if(playerCommand.startsWith("YELL") || playerCommand.startsWith("YeLL") || playerCommand.startsWith("YelL") || playerCommand.startsWith("Yell")){ //command }
Magic.

Also, I believe this is against the rules:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


this is all rather basic for PI…

[/quote]
There something called equalsIgnoreCase for a reason…[/quote]
I know, but it doesn’t work properly with playerCommands in PI. I know because I tested.
Or my server is retarded.

Read full topic

That’s not my command… I coded the second yell command I posted, I was showing the example of how sloppy deathlypvpz yell methods were.

My bad, didn’t read the entire post, just skimmed. :o However, you could still improve your chat command, instead of the six if-else statements, use a switch statement. It increases efficiency very slightly, but more importantly, it’s more readable.

item.title: [Pi] Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

bob2568:

Yeah but it’s a simple fix, simply use startsWith, but then that’ll give you a few problems aswell.

There would be no problems. It just means that the command is case sensitive.

I’m also assuming RiiPiiN meant you didn’t know what the equalsIgnoreCase method means because

[quote=“k1ng0frs, post:4, topic:524012”] if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell") || playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("Yell") || playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("YELL") || playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("yel"))
?[/quote]
there would be no need to put in both

playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("Yell") || playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("YELL")

since they are the same strings and the equalsIgnoreCase Boolean would already ignore the case for “yell” meaning that the second is redundant and unneeded.

Edit: Sorry RandQm, didn’t see your post yet.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

bob2568:

Yeah but it’s a simple fix, simply use startsWith, but then that’ll give you a few problems aswell.

EQUALS IGNORE CASE
it checks for the characters without checking the cases, so if you just write yElL it will out put as correct as when you type yell, Yell or whatever,
so you don’t have to go || yell || Yell … just one is enough
Though you shouldn’t use this for yell, since you want the command to be followed by text, so just using startswith should do it

Read full topic
